telegraph.methods.grp_methods module

class telegraph.methods.grp_methods.AssociationScore(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: GroupMethodClass

Association Score between

how strongly is observation i in ‘from’ associated with feature f in ‘from’

Calculates Q where, Q_{if} indicates how strongly associated observation i in ‘from’ is with feature f in ‘to_pred’.

We use the formula: $Q = T^t cdot X_to_pred = T^t cdot (T cdot X_{to_pred})$

The dimensions for the objects are:

X_from : [n_from] x [n_var] (e.g., spatial gene expression) X_to_pred : [n_to] x [n_var] (e.g., single cell gene expression) T : [n_to] x [n_from] (e.g., map of single cells to visium spots) Q : [n_from] x [n_var]

Q should be a pd.DataFrame object

ins = ['X_from', 'X_to_pred', 'T']
outs = ['D_from']
